page.title: 16Poaching in Llangeitho area
page.content: There is a tradition of poaching in the area but this is not so true nowadays. Before myxomatosis decimated the rabbit population, the local farmers invited professional trappers to visit their farms. The farmer would share the money received for the trapped rabbits. As there are now very few rabbits, there are no professional trappers and also very little poaching. There is still some poaching for salmon and sea-trout in the autumn when they are spawning in the River Aeron. They are taken by using a torch and gaff at night. However, due to the heavy fines imposed for this offence, this is also decreasing. There is little feathered game in the area, although pheasants are increasing due to breeding and releasing. The grey partridge is unfortunately extinct.
